author: Staff Reporter
text:
Election awareness posters have been pasted on the name board of the Tirupur North taluk office

An idea mooted by Tahsildar (Tirupur North) S. Murugadoss to motivate people exercise their franchise in the coming Assembly elections, is gaining attention.

Knowing that thousands of people visit the taluk office every day, he has pasted different sets of posters on the office’s name board explaining how each vote counts in a democratic governance.

Besides this, the official also distributes leaflets containing messages on the responsibilities of citizens when they cast their vote. .

“We are also educating children on the need to take informed decisions in exercising the franchise so that they will in turn go home and convince their parents of the need to go to the polling booths”, said Mr. Murugadoss. Meanwhile, facilitation centres were opened by the election officials at the Collectorate and each of the eight Assembly constituencies in the district on Friday to help the people obtain new electors photo identity cards, deletion of names and carry out corrections in the voters list, among other things.
title: Tahsildar comes up with a novel idea
